citeinfo.origin: National Oceanic and Atmospheric Administration (NOAA), National Environmental Satellite, Data and Information Service (NESDIS), Office of Satellite Data Processing and Distribution (OSDPD)
citeinfo.title: Low Resolution (28 and 50 km) Land/Sea Tags

descript.abstract: A global grid of 'low resolution' land/sea tags is maintained and used both to check AVHRR targets and to determine at which grid points SST field temperatures will be maintained. The resolution of these tags is 28 and 50 km centered on the grid point. The grid spacing is 1/2 degree between 85N and 85S. The file is divided into 3 regions, each two records long with some overlap of regions to minimize the number of reads necessary in target processing. The regions are as follows: 1) 85S-25S, 2) 30S to 30N, and 3) 25N-85N. The polar regions are considered to be perpetually ice-covered and no SST targets in these regions will be processed.

idinfo.accconst: Check with Source about how to obtain data.

distinfo.distliab: While every effort has been made to ensure that these data are accurate and reliable within the limits of the current state of the art, NOAA cannot assume liability for any damages caused by any errors or omissions in the data, nor as a result of the failure of the data to function on a particular system. NOAA makes no warranty, expressed or implied, nor does the fact of distribution constitute such a warranty.
